mcqs.question_en: When you reverse the digits of the number 13, the number increases by 18. How many other two-digit numbers increase by 18 when their digits are reversed?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation We are solving: (Reversed number) - (Original number) = 18 Let the original two-digit number be 10x + y Reversed = 10y + x So: (10y + x) - (10x + y) = 18 ‚Üí 9y - 9x = 18 ‚Üí y - x = 2 Now we find how many two-digit numbers satisfy: Units digit = Tens digit + 2 Possible values for x (tens digit): 1 to 7 Since y = x + 2 must still be a digit (i.e., ‚â§ 9) Let‚Äôs list them: - x = 1 ‚Üí y = 3 ‚Üí 13 - x = 2 ‚Üí y = 4 ‚Üí 24 - x = 3 ‚Üí y = 5 ‚Üí 35 - x = 4 ‚Üí y = 6 ‚Üí 46 - x = 5 ‚Üí y = 7 ‚Üí 57 - x = 6 ‚Üí y = 8 ‚Üí 68 - x = 7 ‚Üí y = 9 ‚Üí 79 That's 7 total, including 13. But your question was: "How many *other two-digit numbers increase by 18 when reversed?"* So, exclude 13 itself. Answer: 6 other numbers.

mcqs.question_en: A father is 7 times as old as his son. Two years ago, he was 13 times as old. What are their current ages?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Two years ago: 7x - 2 = 13(x - 2) ‚Üí x = 4, father = 28)

mcqs.question_en: If A and B together can complete a piece of work in 15 days and B alone in 20 days, then in how many days can A alone complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: - A + B can complete the work in 15 days - B alone can complete the work in 20 days Step 1: Work done per day - (A + B)‚Äôs one day work = 1/15 - B‚Äôs one day work = 1/20 Step 2: A‚Äôs one day work A‚Äôs 1 day work = (A + B)‚Äôs work - B‚Äôs work = 1/15 - 1/20 Find LCM of 15 and 20 = 60 So: = (4 - 3)/60 = 1/60 Final Answer: A alone can complete the work in 60 days

mcqs.question_en: A set containing no element is called _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A set with no elements is commonly referred to as a null set, empty set, or void set. All these terms mean the same: a set with zero elements , usually denoted by √ò or { }.

mcqs.question_en: How many subsets does an empty subset have?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The empty set ‚àÖ has exactly one subset, which is itself (‚àÖ).

mcqs.question_en: To write an empty set we use the symbol ____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In mathematics, the empty set is the unique set having no elements; its size or cardinality is zero. Some axiomatic set theories ensure that the empty set exists by including an axiom of empty set , while in other theories, its existence can be deduced.

mcqs.question_en: If Monday is the 1st day of the month, the 13th day will be ______?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Counting from Monday as the 1st day : 1 ‚Üí Monday 2 ‚Üí Tuesday 3 ‚Üí Wednesday 4 ‚Üí Thursday 5 ‚Üí Friday 6 ‚Üí Saturday 7 ‚Üí Sunday 8 ‚Üí Monday 9 ‚Üí Tuesday 10 ‚Üí Wednesday 11 ‚Üí Thursday 12 ‚Üí Friday 13 ‚Üí Saturday Thus, the 13th day falls on Saturday .

mcqs.question_en: If A is mother of B and C is child of B, then what is the relationship between A and C?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A is B‚Äôs mother, and C is B‚Äôs child, so A is one generation above C. Parent of a parent = grandparent, here specifically grandmother .

mcqs.question_en: In a family of six members: P is the father of Q, R is the mother of Q, S is the sister of Q, T is the brother of P. Who is the Uncle of Q?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation T is P‚Äôs brother (P is Q‚Äôs father), so T is Q‚Äôs paternal uncle . R is Q‚Äôs mother and S is Q‚Äôs sister ‚Äî neither is an uncle.

mcqs.question_en: Statements: All melons are apples. No apples are mangoes. Which of the following conclusions about the given statements are true? Conclusion 1: All melons are mangoes. Conclusion 2: Apples are not mangoes.

mcqs.question_en: A tank can hold 240 liters of water. Currently, water is filled to one third of its capacity. How much more water can it hold?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation One-third of 240 L = 80 L currently filled. Remaining capacity = 240 ‚àí 80 = 160 L .

mcqs.question_en: A new virus is spreading rapidly in the city. The government should impose temporary travel restrictions. What is true about this course of action?
options: The government should promote travel to support the economy
Travel restrictions help control the virus spread
Travel restrictions do not affect virus transmission
mcqs.correct_answer: Travel restrictions help control the virus spread
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Travel restrictions help control the virus spread. Limiting movement reduces transmission between areas. It helps contain the outbreak more effect ively.

mcqs.question_en: Complete the series: 3 | 3 | 3 | 6 | 3 | 9 | 3 | ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pattern in the series alternates between 3 and a number that increases by 3: 3 | 3 | 3 | 6 | 3 | 9 | 3 | ? The numbers in the positions 2, 4, and 6 (i.e., the non-3 positions) increase by 3: 3 ‚Üí 6 ‚Üí 9. Following this, the next non-3 number would logically be 12. Thus, the completed series is: 3 | 3 | 3 | 6 | 3 | 9 | 3 | 12.

mcqs.question_en: Determine the total number of triangles present in the given figure. (NOTE: The complete solution is provided in the detailed section below.)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: Smallest triangles If we look at the smallest possible divisions: Top section: 4 small triangles Bottom left: 2 small triangles Bottom right: 2 small triangles Total smallest ones = 8 Step 2: Medium triangles (made of 2 or 3 small ones) Top part: 2 medium triangles (one on left, one on right) Bottom part: 2 medium triangles (left, right) Total medium = 4 Step 3: Larger triangles inside main shape One triangle formed by the top half (entire top section) One triangle formed by bottom left section One triangle formed by bottom right section Total larger ones = 3 Step 4: The whole triangle The largest triangle is the whole outline = 1 Grand total = 8 (small) + 4 (medium) + 3 (large) + 1 (whole) = 16 triangles

mcqs.question_en: Which word does not belong to the group in each of the following questions? Nose, Lip, Ear, Chest

mcqs.question_en: Find the missing number: 4 6 7 31, 9 8 4 76, 7 4 2 _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1 ‚Äì Identify the pattern It seems each number in row D is obtained from the numbers above it in A, B, C. Check first column: A1 = 4, B1 = 6, C1 = 7 ‚Üí D1 = 31 Possible formula: 4√ó6 = 24, 24 + 7 = 31. So: A √ó B + C = D Step 2 ‚Äì Verify with second column A2 = 9, B2 = 8, C2 = 4 9 √ó 8 = 72, 72 + 4 = 76 ‚úî works. Step 3 ‚Äì Apply to third column A3 = 7, B3 = 4, C3 = 2 7 √ó 4 = 28, 28 + 2 = 30. So missing number = 30 .

mcqs.question_en: If 2^x + 2^x+1 = 3, then find value of x?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 2^x + 2^x+1 = 3 Take out 2^x common: 2^x(1 + 2) = 3 2^x √ó 3 = 3 Divide both sides by 3 ‚Üí 2^x = 1 2^0 = 1 ‚Üí so x = 0

mcqs.question_en: Monday is to March as Friday is to _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Number the days: Sunday = 1, Monday = 2, ‚Ä¶ Friday = 6. Add 1 to the day's number to get the month's number: Monday (2) ‚Üí 2+1 = 3 ‚Üí March . So Friday (6) ‚Üí 6+1 = 7 ‚Üí July .

mcqs.question_en: If SECRET is coded as 102807 the ERRECT coded as _____?

mcqs.question_en: The perimeter of a semicircle is 144 cm then the radius is ____?

mcqs.question_en: What is the value of x if 16 : 24 :: x : 72?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The given ratio is 16:24, which can be simplified as 2:3 (by dividing both numbers by 8). To maintain the same ratio, we need to find the number that will maintain the 2:3 ratio with 72. Let's multiply 72 by 2/3: (2/3) √ó 72 = 48 So, the correct answer is: 48 The ratio 16:24 is equivalent to 2:3, and similarly, the ratio ? : 72 is equivalent to 2:3, which leads to the answer 48 .

mcqs.question_en: 4 men and 2 women can complete a work in 2 days. If 2 men alone take 5 days to complete the work, find the time taken by 2 women alone to complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: 2 men complete the work in 5 days ‚Üí Work of 1 man in 1 day = 1 / (2√ó5) = 1/10 Step 2: So, 4 men‚Äôs 1-day work = 4 √ó (1/10) = 2/5 Step 3: (4 men + 2 women) finish work in 2 days ‚Üí 1-day work = 1/2 Step 4: Work of 2 women in 1 day = 1/2 ‚àí 2/5 = (5‚àí4)/10 = 1/10 ‚Üí 1 woman‚Äôs 1-day work = 1/20 Step 5: Hence, 2 women will take = 1 / (2√ó1/20) = 10 days

mcqs.question_en: 5 % income of A is equal to 15 % income of B and 10 % income of B is equal to 20 % income of C if the income of C is Rs. 2000, then total income of A, B and C is ______?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: 5% of A = 15% of B ‚Üí 0.05A = 0.15B ‚Üí A = 3B 10% of B = 20% of C ‚Üí0.10B = 0.20C ‚Üí B = 2C Now, C = 2000 ‚Üí B = 2 √ó 2000 = 4000 ‚Üí A = 3 √ó 4000 = 12000 Total income = A + B + C = 12000 + 4000 + 2000 = 18000

mcqs.question_en: A man sold 20 articles for Rs. 60 and gained 20%. How many articles did he buy for Rs.60?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation He sold 20 articles for Rs. 60 and gained 20%. Let C.P. of 1 article = x Then, S.P. of 1 article = x √ó 1.2 So for 20 articles: 20 √ó 1.2x = 60 ‚Üí x = 60/24 = 2.5 Thus, cost of 1 article = Rs. 2.5 Now, how many articles can he buy for Rs. 60? 60 √∑ 2.5 = 24

mcqs.question_en: When a plot is sold for Rs. 18,700, the owner loses 15%. At what price must that plot be sold in order to gain 15%?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: Selling Price (SP‚ÇÅ) = Rs. 18,700 Loss = 15% So, Cost Price (CP) = SP1 √ó 100/100-15 = 18,700√ó100 = 22,000 To gain 15%, Now Selling Price (SP2) = CP √ó 115/100 = 22,000 √ó 1.15 = 25,300

mcqs.question_en: A and B started business in partnership investing Rs. 20,000 and Rs. 15,000 respectively. After six months, C joined them with Rs. 20,000. What will be B‚Äôs share in the total profit of Rs. 25,000 earned at the end of 2 years from the start of the business?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Investment details: A = Rs. 20,000 for 24 months B = Rs. 15,000 for 24 months C = Rs. 20,000 for 18 months (joined after 6 months) Now calculate capital √ó time for each: A ‚Üí 20,000 √ó 24 = 480,000 B ‚Üí 15,000 √ó 24 = 360,000 C ‚Üí 20,000 √ó 18 = 360,000 Ratio of their investments: A : B : C = 480,000 : 360,000 : 360,000 Simplify ‚Üí 4 : 3 : 3 Total parts = 4 + 3 + 3 = 10 Total profit = Rs. 25,000 B‚Äôs share = 3/10 √ó 25,000 = 7,500

mcqs.question_en: (64)‚Öî is equal to _____?

mcqs.question_en: If 12 members family spend Rs. 850 in 10 days. Then a family of 8 people will spend Rs. 340 in how many days.
mcqs.explanation:
Explanation Given: 12 people ‚Üí Rs. 850 in 10 days 8 people ‚Üí Rs. 340 in ? days Let the required number of days be x . Use the formula for compound proportion: 12 √ó 10 ‚Äã. 850 = 8 √ó x/ 340 ‚Äã Step 2: Solve the equation 120./ 850 ‚Äã = 8 x/ 340 ‚Äã Cross-multiply: 120 times 340 = 850 times 8x
Rightarrow 40800 = 6800x
Rightarrow x = frac{40800}{6800} = 6 120 √ó 340 = 850 √ó 8 x ‚áí 40800 = 6800 x ‚áí x = 40800 ‚Äã/ 6800 = 6

mcqs.question_en: A group of people has provisions for 29 days for 24 men. If after 4 days 1/6 of them desert, then food will last for?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: Food for 24 men = 29 days So, total food = 24 √ó 29 = 696 man-days (means food for 696 men for 1 day). They eat for 4 days first: In 4 days, 24 men eat = 24 √ó 4 = 96 man-days of food. Remaining food = 696 ‚àí 96 = 600 man-days. Now, 1/6 of 24 men leave ‚Üí 24 √ó (1/6) = 4 men leave. Remaining men = 24 ‚àí 4 = 20 men. Now 600 man-days of food for 20 men ‚Üí 600 √∑ 20 = 30 days .

mcqs.question_en: 25% of 30% of 45% is equal to _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To evaluate this expression, we need to follow the order of operations (PEMDAS): Calculate 25% of 30%: 0.25 x 0.30 = 0.075 Calculate 0.075 as a percentage of 45%: 0.075 x 0.45 = 0.03375 So, the correct answer is: 0.03375

mcqs.question_en: Look at this series: 8, 43, 11, 41, ______, 39, 17. What number should fill in the blank?

mcqs.question_en: Look at this series: 80, 10, 70, 15, 60, ______? What number should come next?

Two alternating patterns: 1st, 3rd, 5th terms: 80 ‚Üí 70 ‚Üí 60 ‚Üí (next will be 50) ‚Üí decreasing by 10. 2nd, 4th, 6th terms: 10 ‚Üí 15 ‚Üí (next will be 20) ‚Üí increasing by 5. After 60, the next term should follow the second pattern ‚Üí 20

mcqs.question_en: Ratio from 5 feet to 3 inches is ______?

mcqs.question_en: What is the value of x in the equation   x/5 - 3x/2 = 7 + x/2?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: x/5 - (3x/2) = 7 + x/2 Step 1: Eliminate fractions by finding a common denominator The LCM of 5 and 2 is 10. Multiply both sides of the equation by 10: 10 √ó (x/5 - 3x/2) = 10 √ó (7 + x/2) (2x - 15x) = 70 + 5x -13x = 70 + 5x Step 2: Move all terms to one side -13x - 5x = 70 -18x = 70 Step 3: Solve for x x = 70 / -18 = - 35/9

mcqs.question_en: What is the equation type for A and B working together problems?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation When solving problems where A and B work together, you are essentially comparing their individual rates of work and how they combine to form a total rate. This is a classic application of ratios and proportions.

mcqs.question_en: Of the class of 40 students, 20% are girls. how many boys are in the class?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If 20% of the students are girls, then the remaining percentage (100% - 20% = 80%) represents the boys. So, in a class of 40 students: 80% of 40 = (80/100) * 40 = 0.8 * 40 = 32 Therefore, there are 32 boys in the class.

mcqs.question_en: HCF of 30, 24, 18 is?

mcqs.question_en: Find the average of 5/6, 4/3, 3/4?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the average, we need to first convert each fraction to a decimal: 5/6 = 0.83 4/3 = 1.33 3/4 = 0.75 Then, add the decimals and divide by the number of values: 0.83 + 1.33 + 0.75 = 2.91 2.91 √∑ 3 = 0.97 Now, convert the average back to a fraction: 0.97 ‚âà 35/36

mcqs.question_en: What comes next in the following series 64, 48, 40, 36, 34, ______?

mcqs.question_en: If the tire of a car makes 4000 revolutions to cover 8 km, what is the diameter of the tire?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: Discount = 20% Selling Price (after discount) = Rs. 70 We need to find the Marked Price. --- Step-by-step solution: Let Marked Price = x After 20% discount, the customer pays 80% of the marked price. mcqs.question_en: A school has only four classes that contain 10, 20, 30, and 40 students respectively. The pass percentage of these classes are 20%, 30%, 60%, and 100% respectively. Find the pass % of the entire school.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: Multiply the number of students in each class by their pass percentage - Class 1: 10 students √ó 20% = 2 passed - Class 2: 20 students √ó 30% = 6 passed - Class 3: 30 students √ó 60% = 18 passed - Class 4: 40 students √ó 100% = 40 passed Step 2: Add total passed students and total students - Total passed = 2 + 6 + 18 + 40 = 66 - Total students = 10 + 20 + 30 + 40 = 100 Step 3: Calculate the overall percentage Pass % = (66 / 100) √ó 100 = 66%

mcqs.question_en: If the average of 5,6,7 and X is 10. What is the value of 'X' ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Average of 5, 6, 7, and X = 10 Use the average formula: (5 + 6 + 7 + X) / 4 = 10 Add the numbers: (18 + X) / 4 = 10 Multiply both sides by 4: 18 + X = 40 Now solve for X: X = 40 - 18 = 22

mcqs.question_en: The arithmetic mean between 4 and 6 is?

mcqs.question_en: If x% of 60 = 48, then x = ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 100 x ‚Äã √ó 60 = 48 x √ó 0.6 = 48 x = 48/ 0.6 ‚Äã x = 80

mcqs.question_en: A man standing up side down with his face towards south, where will his left hand point?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A man is standing upside down with his face towards the south . Normally, if a person stands upright facing south , their left hand points east and right hand points west . When flipped upside down , the directions of their hands do not change relative to their body. Thus, the left hand will still point east

mcqs.question_en: A train running at the speed of 60 km | hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the length of the train, use the formula: Speed = Distance / Time So, Distance = Speed √ó Time Speed = 60 km/h = (60 √ó 1000) / 3600 = 16.67 m/s Time = 9 seconds Now, Distance = 16.67 √ó 9 ‚âà 150 meters

mcqs.question_en: If "Y" completes a particular work in 8 days, and "Z" in 24 days, how many days will it take if they work together?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Combined rate = 1/8 + 1/24 = 1/6. Hence, time taken together = 6 days.

mcqs.question_en: A vendor sells 40 percent of his stock of oranges and is left with only 420 oranges. What was the total number of oranges available before the sell?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 60% of total = 420 ‚Üí total x = 420 √∑ 0.6. Hence, total oranges = 700 .

mcqs.question_en: Perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 3 cm is _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Add length and width ‚Üí 8 + 3 = 11. Multiply by 2 ‚Üí 2 √ó 11 = 22 cm .

mcqs.question_en: In a hotel, 60% had vegetarian lunch while 30% had non-vegeterian lunch and 15% had both type of lunch. If 96 people were present, how many did not eat either type of lunch?

mcqs.question_en: A square region has an area of 2304 m. Find its perimeter?

mcqs.question_en: Which among the following numbers is exactly divisible by 11, 13 and 7?

mcqs.question_en: (2,5), (4,7), (17,6) are the examples of ____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Each pair (2,5), (4,7), (17,6) has no common factor other than 1 . Hence, they are co-prime (relatively prime) numbers .

mcqs.question_en: A Batsman makes a score of 87 runs in the 17th inning and thus increases his average by 1. Find his average after 17th inning?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the average after 17th innings = x Then average after 16th innings = (x - 3) Therefore 16 √ó (x - 3) + 87 = 17x Therefore x = 39

mcqs.question_en: When you divide 0.7 by 10 you will get?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If you divide a decimal by 10 , the decimal point will move one place to the left. 0.7 / 10 = 0.07

mcqs.question_en: A box contains 5 red balls, 4 blue balls and 3 green balls. Two balls are drawn at random without replacement. What is the probability that both balls are of different colors?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total ways = (12 2) = 66; same color ways = 10 + 6 + 3 = 19 Different color ways = 66 - 19 = 47; so probability = 47/66 .

mcqs.question_en: In a code, DRAIN is written as ^!#*@ and RAND is written as !#@^, then how can we write the word NARD in the code?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation From DRAIN ‚Üí ^!#*@ , we get the mapping: D‚Üí^, R‚Üí!, A‚Üí#, I‚Üí*, N‚Üí@. Encode NARD as N(@) A(#) R(!) D(^) ‚Üí @#!^ .

mcqs.question_en: Solve number analogy: 123 : 13¬≤ :: 235 : _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation For 123 ‚Üí 13¬≤, the first and last digits 1 and 3 form 13, then squared gives 169. Apply same rule to 235 ‚Üí first and last digits 2 and 5 form 25, squared gives 625 .

mcqs.question_en: A TV is purchased at Rs. 5000 and sold at Rs. 4000, find the lost percent?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Cost Price (CP) = Rs. 5000 Selling Price (SP) = Rs. 4000 Loss = CP ‚àí SP = 5000 ‚àí 4000 = Rs. 1000 Loss % = (Loss / CP) √ó 100 = (1000 / 5000) √ó 100 = 20%

mcqs.question_en: The ratio of cost price and selling price is 4 : 5. The profit percent is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation f the ratio of Cost Price (CP) to Selling Price (SP) is 4:5, it means: - CP = 4 units - SP = 5 units Profit = SP ‚àí CP = 5 ‚àí 4 = 1 unit Profit % = (Profit / CP) √ó 100 = (1 / 4) √ó 100 = 25%

mcqs.question_en: The letters of the CHORD taken all at a time can be written in?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word CHORD has 5 distinct letters: C-H-O-R-D . When taking all the letters together, the number of ways to arrange them is equal to the number of permutations of 5 items, which is calculated as: 5! = 5 √ó 4 √ó 3 √ó 2 √ó 1 = 120

mcqs.question_en: Solve number analogy: LM : 1213 :: CD : ____?

mcqs.question_en: Number sequence: 6, 7, 11, 20, ____?

mcqs.question_en: Choose the correct analogous pair: 31 : 90 :: 43 : _____?

mcqs.question_en: The number of boys in a class is three times the number of girls. Which one of the following numbers cannot represent the total number of children in the class?

mcqs.question_en: Average age of A and B is 30 years, that of B and C is 32 years and the average age of C and A is 34 years. The age of C is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the ages of A, B, and C be A, B, and C respectively. We are given: 1. (A + B)/2 = 30¬† ‚Üí A + B = 60 2. (B + C)/2 = 32¬† ‚Üí B + C = 64 3. (C + A)/2 = 34¬† ‚Üí C + A = 68 Now add all three equations: (A + B) + (B + C) + (C + A) = 60 + 64 + 68 ‚áí 2A + 2B + 2C = 192 Divide both sides by 2: A + B + C = 96 Now use this to find C: From (A + B = 60), so: C = 96 - 60 = 36

mcqs.question_en: 3 boxes have some average weight .when one box which weight 89kg is replaced by another box ,the average weight increases by 5kg .how much the new box weight‚Äã?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the original average weight of the 3 boxes = x kg So, total weight = 3x When a 89 kg box is replaced and average increases by 5 kg, New average = x + 5 New total = 3(x + 5) = 3x + 15 So the new box weight = (Old total - 89) + New box = New total ‚áí 3x - 89 + New box = 3x + 15 ‚áí New box = 3x + 15 - (3x - 89) = 104 kg

mcqs.question_en: A man buys an article for Rs. 27 50 and sells it for Rs. 28.60. Find his gain percent?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Cost Price (CP) = Rs. 27.50 Selling Price (SP) = Rs. 28.60 Gain = SP - CP = 28.60 - 27.50 = Rs. 1.10 Gain % = (Gain / CP) √ó 100 = (1.10 / 27.50) √ó 100 = 4%

mcqs.question_en: Total number of students in a class is 95. If the total numberon girls in the class is 45, then the ratio of total number of boys to total number of girls is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total students = 95 Girls = 45 So, Boys = 95 - 45 = 50 Ratio of boys to girls = 50 : 45 Simplify by dividing both by 5: = 10 : 9

mcqs.question_en: x, 9, 25, 48, 81, 121 find the value of x?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - 9 - x = ? - 25 - 9 = 16 - 48 - 25 = 23 - 81 - 48 = 33 - 121 - 81 = 40 Now look at the differences: 16, 23, 33, 40 Now check differences of differences: - 23 - 16 = 7 - 33 - 23 = 10 - 40 - 33 = 7 There‚Äôs a slightly alternating pattern in second differences: 7, 10, 7... Assuming this pattern continues backward, before 16, we should subtract 10 (alternating) ‚áí 16 - 10 = 6 So: 9 - x = 6 ‚áí x = 3

mcqs.question_en: Length and width of a field are is the ratio 5:3. if the width of the field is 42 m, then its length is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Length : Width = 5 : 3 Given width = 42 m To find the factor: 3 parts = 42 1 part = 42 √∑ 3 = 14 Length (5 parts) = 5 √ó 14 = 70 m

mcqs.question_en: Income of A is 25% less than B. How much percent B‚Äôs income would be more than that of A?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let's say that B makes $100. Then A makes $75. So, your question then becomes 100 is what percent of 75? This can be solved by setting up the proportion 100 / 75 = x / 100 75x = 10000 x = 133.3 So, B's income is 33.3% more than A's income.

mcqs.question_en: Complete the series: 2, 6,18, 54, _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 2 x 3 =6 6 x 3 =18 18 x 3 =54 54 x 3 = 162

mcqs.question_en: Aslia has three types of balls red green and blue. If their ratio is 2:3:5 what percent of balls are green?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given ratio of red : green : blue balls = 2 : 3 : 5 Total parts = 2 + 3 + 5 = 10 Green balls = 3 parts Percentage of green balls = (3 / 10) √ó 100 = 30%

mcqs.question_en: A is twice as good as workman as B and together they finish a piece of work i 18 days. In how may days will B alone finish the work?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: - A is twice as good a workman as B ‚Üí A‚Äôs work rate = 2 parts, B‚Äôs = 1 part ‚Üí Combined rate = 3 parts - Together they finish the work in 18 days ‚Üí So total work = 3 √ó 18 = 54 units Now, B alone does 1 part/day ‚áí Time B alone will take = 54 / 1 = 54 days

mcqs.question_en: 9 is 1/3% of what number?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Since 9 is 1/3% of x: 9 = (1/3)/100 √ó x 9 = (1/300) √ó x Multiply both sides by 300: 2700 = x

mcqs.question_en: A solution of water and sugar contains 10% sugar the solution weight is 8kg when 2kg of water is added to this solution the percentage of sugar becomes?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - Initial sugar percentage = 10% - Initial solution weight = 8 kg - Sugar = 10% of 8 kg = 0.8 kg - Water = 8 kg - 0.8 kg = 7.2 kg Now, 2 kg of water is added: - New total weight = 8 kg + 2 kg = 10 kg - Sugar still = 0.8 kg (unchanged) New sugar percentage = (0.8 / 10) √ó 100 = 8% Answer: 8%

mcqs.question_en: Which one is different from the rest? Like, Distinguish, Same, Similar
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Distinguish means to recognize or point out a difference between things. Like, Same, and Similar ‚Äîall express a state of being alike or having comparable characteristics .

mcqs.question_en: Sami was 21 years old in 1945, how old will be in 1965?

mcqs.question_en: A is the brother of B. B is the brother of C. D is the father of A. Based on these three statements, which of the following statements cannot be definitely true?
options: C is the brother of A
A is the brother of C
B is the brother of A
B is the son of D
mcqs.correct_answer: C is the brother of A
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A is the brother of B. This establishes that A is male. B is the brother of C. This establishes that B is male. D is the father of A. This means D is also the father of B and C , since they are siblings. The relationship between C and A is that they are siblings . However, the gender of C is not specified in the given statements. C could be a male (brother) or a female (sister).

mcqs.question_en: Find the fourth proportion to 3, 7 and 9?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The fourth proportion to numbers a, b,c is the number x such that: a/b = c/x ‚üπ x = b.c/a Given: a = 3, b = 7, c = 9 x = 7.9/3 = 63/3 = 21

mcqs.question_en: 3.5 can be expressed in terms of percentage as ______?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To convert a decimal to percentage, multiply by 100: 3.5 √ó 100 = 350%

mcqs.question_en: The price of petrol is increased by 25%. By how much percent a car owner should reduce his consumption of petrol so, that expenditure on petrol would not increase?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Price ‚Üë 25% ‚Üí Multiply consumption by (1 - x/100) to keep expenditure same. Solve: 1.25 √ó (100 - x) = 100 ‚Üí x = 20% .

mcqs.question_en: The cost price of an article is 64% of the marked price. Calculate the gain percentage after allowing a discount of 12%?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Take CP as 64% of MP. SP after 12% discount = 88% of MP. Gain = SP ‚Äì CP = 0.88 ‚Äì 0.64 = 0.24 ‚Üí Gain % = (0.24/0.64) √ó 100 = 37.5%.

mcqs.question_en: Find out the wrong number in the series: 1, 1, 2, 6, 24, 96, 720?

mcqs.question_en: The top of a 15-metre-high tower makes an angle of elevation of 60¬∞ with the bottom of an electric pole and angle of elevation of 30¬∞ with the top of the pole. What is the height of the electric pole?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation ‚à†ACB = 60 , ‚à†EDB = 30 , AB=15 , AC=DE BE = AB ‚àí AE =15‚àíh AB/AC=tan60 = ‚àö3 AC=15/‚àö3 BE/DE= tan30 = 1/‚àö3 DE=‚àö3*(15‚àíh) As AC = DE 15/‚àö3 = ‚àö3*(15‚àíh) 15 = 45 - 3h h = 30/3 h = 10

mcqs.question_en: An amount of 5000 is invested at a fixed rate of 8 percent per annum. What amount will be the value of the investment in five years‚Äô time, if the interest is compounded every six months?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Convert annual rate to half-yearly ‚Üí 8% √∑ 2 = 4% Multiply time in years by 2 ‚Üí 5 √ó 2 = 10 periods Apply formula: A = 5000(1.04)¬π‚Å∞ = 7401.22

mcqs.question_en: A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 815 in 3 years and to Rs. 854 in 4 years. The sum is _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation S.I. for 1 year = Rs. (854 - 815) = Rs. 39. S.I. for 3 years = Rs. (39 x 3) = Rs. 117. Therefore Principal = Rs. (815 - 117) = Rs. 698 .

mcqs.question_en: If 18 men can eat 20 kg of rice in 3 days how long with 6 men take to eat 40 kg of rice?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Solution-1 6 men 3 times as long to eat 20 that is equals 9 days and multiply that number by 2 Answer: 18 days Solution-2 20/18=1.11 kg per day for 18 men 1.11/3=.37037 each man each day 40/6=6.67 kg per day for 6 men 6.67/x=.37037 x = 18 days

mcqs.question_en: Twelve children take sixteen days to complete a work which can be completed by eight adults in twelve days. Sixteen adults started working and after three days, ten adults left and four children joined them. How many days will they take to complete the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Work done by 12 children in 16 days = 1 (full work) Work done by 1 child in 16 days = 1/12 Work done by 1 child in 1 day = 1/(12 √ó 16) = 1/192 Work done by 8 adults in 12 days = 1 Work done by 1 adult in 12 days = 1/8 Work done by 1 adult in 1 day = 1/(8 √ó 12) = 1/96 Work done by 16 adults in 3 days = 16 √ó 3 √ó (1/96) = 1/2 Remaining work = 1 - 1/2 = 1/2 Now, 6 adults and 4 children work together: Work done by 6 adults in 1 day = 6 √ó 1/96 = 6/96 = 1/16 Work done by 4 children in 1 day = 4 √ó 1/192 = 4/192 = 1/48 Total work done per day = (1/16 + 1/48) = (3 + 1)/48 = 4/48 = 1/12 Days required = (1/2) √∑ (1/12) = 6 days

mcqs.question_en: One Gross is equal to ______?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A gross is a unit that equals 12 dozen . 1 dozen = 12 12 dozen = 12 √ó 12 = 144 ‚Üí which is 1 gross .

Look at the numbers between 18s: 21 ‚Üí 25 ‚Üí difference = +4 29 ‚Üí 33 ‚Üí difference = +4 So the pattern between 18s is: start number, +4 ‚Üí next number, then 18 appears. Applying this to the next numbers after 18 (position 7): 18 ‚Üí next = 37 (since previous +4 pattern continued) next after 37 = 41 Sequence becomes: 18, 21, 25, 18, 29, 33, 18, 37, 41 , 18

mcqs.question_en: If Arif can read 39 pages of a book in half an hour. How long will it take him to finish a book that is 1287 pages?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Arif reads 39 pages in 0.5 hours, so in 1 hour he reads: 39 √ó 2 = 78¬†pages/hour Total pages in the book = 1287 pages. Time to finish: Time = Total pages/Pages per hour = 1287/78 = 16.5 hours

mcqs.question_en: If base of right-angled triangle is 8 cm, height is 4 cm, what would be the area of triangle?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The formula for the area of a right-angled triangle is half the product of its base and height. Area = 1/2 √ó base √ó height Substitute the base (b=8 cm) and height (h=4 cm) into the formula. A = 1/2 √ó 8 cm √ó 4 cm Calculate the product to find the area. A = 1/2 √ó 32 cm¬≤ A = 16 cm¬≤

mcqs.question_en: Find the ratio of 18 inches to 2 yards?

mcqs.question_en: If ‚Äò+‚Äô means ‚Äò√ó‚Äô and ‚Äò‚Äì‚Äô means ‚Äò+‚Äô, then what will be the value of 56 + 20 ‚Äì 19?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: Replace symbols ‚Üí 56 √ó 20 + 19 Step 2: Multiply ‚Üí 56 √ó 20 = 1120 Step 3: Add ‚Üí 1120 + 19 = 1139

mcqs.question_en: Find the simplified ratio of 360 : 270.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To simplify the ratio 360 : 270: Step 1: Find the GCD (Greatest Common Divisor) of 360 and 270. GCD of 360 and 270 is 90. Step 2: Divide both terms by 90: - 360 √∑ 90 = 4 - 270 √∑ 90 = 3 Simplified Ratio = 4 : 3

mcqs.question_en: If 105 men can complete a work in 45 days, in how many days will 90 men complete the same work (assuming equal efficiency)?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Work = Men √ó Days So, 105 men √ó 45 days = 4725 man-days Now, if 90 men are doing the same work: 4725 man-days √∑ 90 men = 52.5 days

mcqs.question_en: What is the square root of 13 (‚àö13)?

mcqs.question_en: If 20% of an electricity bill is deducted, then Rs 100 is still to be paid. How much was the original bill?

mcqs.question_en: Complete the series 2, 4, 6, 10, 28, ______?

mcqs.question_en: What is the value of x in the equation: 0.2x - 0.03 = 0.4 √ó 0.05?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given equation: 0.2x - 0.03 = 0.4 √ó 0.05 Step 1: Multiply the right side 0.4 √ó 0.05 = 0.02 Now equation becomes: 0.2x - 0.03 = 0.02 Step 2: Add 0.03 to both sides 0.2x = 0.02 + 0.03 0.2x = 0.05 Step 3: Divide both sides by 0.2 x = 0.05 √∑ 0.2 x = 0.25

mcqs.question_en: What number comes after 1,225,310?

mcqs.question_en: A and B do a business together. Their incomes are in the ratio 3 : 2, and their expenses are in the ratio 5 : 3. If each saves Rs. 1000, what are their incomes?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let A and B‚Äôs incomes be 3x and 2x, respectively. Let their expenses be 5y and 3y, respectively. Their savings = Income ‚àí Expense = Rs. 1000 for both. So: For A: 3x ‚àí 5y = 1000¬† ‚Üí (1) For B: 2x ‚àí 3y = 1000¬† ‚Üí (2) Multiply (1) by 2: 6x ‚àí 10y = 2000 Multiply (2) by 3: 6x ‚àí 9y = 3000 Now subtract: (6x ‚àí 10y) ‚àí (6x ‚àí 9y) = 2000 ‚àí 3000 ‚áí ‚àíy = ‚àí1000 ‚áí y = 1000 Now plug y = 1000 into equation (1): 3x ‚àí 5(1000) = 1000 ‚áí 3x = 6000 ‚áí x = 2000 Now find incomes: A's income = 3x = 6000 B's income = 2x = 4000

mcqs.question_en: A toy is sold for Rs. 220, what was the cost if the rate of profit was 10% of the cost?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given Data S.P = 220¬† ¬† ¬†Gain=10%¬† C.P=? We know that : S.P=[ 100 +Gain]/100 * C.P We Have to find C.P, so re-arrange the formula ‚áí C.P= 100/[ 100 +Gain] * S.P Putting given data: ‚áí C.P= 100/[ 100 +10] * 220 ‚áí C.P=200 ***

mcqs.question_en: What is the sum of the interior angles of a triangle?

Since a triangle is essentially half of a quadrilateral Its angle measures should be half as well. Half of 360¬∞ is 180¬∞

mcqs.question_en: 1/2 inch is equal to 12 kilometers the distance between two points is 5-2/3 inches. What is the distance in kilometers?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 1. We are given that 1/2 inch is equal to 12 kilometers. 2. We want to find the distance in kilometers for 5-2/3 inches. First, let's convert the mixed number to an improper fraction: 5-2/3 = 17/3 inches 3. Now, let's set up a proportion using the given conversion factor: (1/2 inch) / 12 km = (17/3 inches) / x km 4. We can then cross-multiply and solve for x: (1/2) √ó x = (17/3) √ó 12 x = (17/3) √ó 12 / (1/2) x = (17/3) √ó 24 x = 136 km So, the distance in kilometers is 136 km .

mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the required speed, we first calculate the distance covered by the train: Distance = Speed √ó Time = 45 km/h √ó 5 hours = 225 km text{Distance} = text{Speed} times text{Time} = 45 , text{km/h} times 5 , text{hours} = 225 , text{km} Now, to cover this 225 km in 3 hours, the required speed is: Speed = Distance/ Time = 225 km/ 3 hours = 75 km/h

mcqs.question_en: In a class, 20 children were sharing equally the cost of a present for their teacher. When 4 of the children decided not to contribute, each of the other children had to pay $1.50 more. How much, in dollars, did the present cost?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - Originally, 20 students shared the cost: Each paid = x / 20 - When 4 students backed out, only 16 shared the cost: Each paid = x / 16 We're told the new amount is $1.50 more than the original amount: x / 16 - x / 20 = 1.5 LCM of 16 and 20 = 80, so: (5x - 4x) / 80 = 1.5 x / 80 = 1.5 Multiply both sides by 80: x = 1.5 √ó 8 0 = 120

mcqs.question_en: If P(2, 1) and Q(8, 1) are two of the vertices of a rectangle, which of the following could not be another of the vertices?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given points P(2,1) and Q(8,1) lie on the same horizontal line (same y = 1) So, any valid rectangle vertex must form a right angle and match in x or y. Check options: - A) (2, 8) ‚Üí shares x with P ‚Üí possible - B) (8, 2) ‚Üí shares x with Q but different y ‚Üí possible - C) (2, -8) ‚Üí shares x with P ‚Üí possible - D) (-2, 8) ‚Üí does not share x or y with either point ‚Üí cannot form right angle with both

mcqs.question_en: A jar has 5 marbles, 1 of each of the colors red, white, blue, green, and yellow. If 4 marbles are removed from the jar, what is the probability that the yellow one was removed?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total marbles = 5 You remove 4 marbles (randomly) We want the probability yellow is among the 4 removed. There are 5 marbles, and you‚Äôre removing 4, so the chance that yellow is among them is: = Number of favorable outcomes / Total outcomes Yellow is in 4 out of 5 possible selections ‚Üí P(yellow is removed) = 4/5

mcqs.question_en: A man starts climbing a hill. Every minute he ascends 20-yards but slips down 5-yards. How long will he take to ascend a point of 80-yards high?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Every minute: Climbs 20 yards, slips 5 yards ‚Üí Net gain = 15 yards/min In 5 minutes, net gain = 15 √ó 5 = 75 yards In the 6th minute, he climbs a full 20 yards to reach 95 yards, but we only need to reach 80 yards ‚Üí So in the 6th minute, he climbs from 75 to 80 yards in (5/20 = 0.25) min = 15 seconds

mcqs.question_en: The mean of the data 6, 2, 2, 3.0, 5, 8, 2.0 is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total = 6 + 2 + 2 + 3 + 5 + 8 + 2 = 28 Number of values = 7 Mean = 28 √∑ 7 = 4

mcqs.question_en: If x ‚â† 0, x(x‚Åµ)‚Å¥ / x‚Å¥ = ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation We simplify the expression: x(x‚Åµ)‚Å¥ / x‚Å¥ Step 1: Simplify the exponent (x‚Åµ)‚Å¥ = x^(5√ó4) = x¬≤‚Å∞ Now the expression becomes: x √ó x¬≤‚Å∞ / x‚Å¥ Step 2: Combine the exponents Numerator: x √ó x¬≤‚Å∞ = x¬≤¬π Now divide: x¬≤¬π / x‚Å¥ = x^(21‚àí4 ) = x¬π‚Å∑

mcqs.question_en: What is the value of (1,000,001)¬≤ ‚àí (999,999)¬≤ ?
If -2x - 5 = 48, what is the value of 2x + 57?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: Solve for x -2x - 5 = 48 Add 5: -2x = 53 Divide by -2: x = -26.5 Now find: 2x + 57 = 2(-26.5) + 57 = -53 + 57 = 4

mcqs.question_en: One day a super market received a delivery of 25 frozen turkeys. If the average (arithmetic mean) weight of a turkey was 14 pounds. what was the total weight in pounds of all the turkeys?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation : Average weight = 14 pounds, Number of turkeys = 25 Total weight = 25 √ó 14 = 350 pounds

mcqs.question_en: In 1999, Danish read 10 English books and 7 Urdu books. In 2000, he read twice as many Urdu books as English books. If 60% of the books that he read during the two years were Urdu, how many books did he read in 2000?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the number of English books Danish read in 2000 = x Then Urdu books in 2000 = 2x (twice as many) Total books: - In 1999: English = 10, Urdu = 7 ‚Üí Total = 17 - In 2000: English = x, Urdu = 2x ‚Üí Total = x + 2x = 3x Total books in 2 years = 17 + 3x Total Urdu books = 7 + 2x Given: 60% of total books were Urdu So: (7 + 2x) / (17 + 3x) = 0.6 Multiply both sides: 7 + 2x = 0.6(17 + 3x) 7 + 2x = 10.2 + 1.8x 2x - 1.8x = 10.2 - 7 0.2x = 3.2 x = 16 So, in 2000: - English = 16 - Urdu = 2√ó16 = 32 - Total = 48

mcqs.question_en: Rabia's average (arithmetic mean) on her six math tests this marking period is 75. Fortunately for Rabia, her teacher drops each student's lowest grade, thus raising Rabia's average to 85. What was her lowest grade?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: - Average of 6 tests = 75 ‚Üí Total marks = 6 √ó 75 = 450 - After dropping lowest grade, average of 5 tests = 85 ‚Üí Total of best 5 tests = 5 √ó 85 = 425 So, the lowest grade = 450 - 425 = 25

mcqs.question_en: If 2a ‚Äì 3b = 10, what is the value of (2a ‚Äì 3b)¬≥ ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation You're given: 2a ‚Äì 3b = 10 To find: (2a ‚Äì 3b)¬≥ This is straightforward: (2a ‚Äì 3b)¬≥ = (10)¬≥ = 1000

mcqs.question_en: A father was twice the age of her daughter 4 years ago. The sum of their ages is 47. What is the daughter's age today?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let daughter's age = x Then father‚Äôs age = 47 - x 4 years ago: Father's age = 47 - x - 4 = 43 - x Daughter's age = x - 4 Given: Father was twice the daughter's age 4 years ago 43 - x = 2(x - 4) 43 - x = 2x - 8 43 + 8 = 3x ‚áí 51 = 3x ‚áí x = 17

mcqs.question_en: If 12 years are added to 2/7 of the age of JAVED he will be 3 years younger to the present age of his elder brother OW AIS who is now 30 years. What is the present age of JAVED?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: (2/7)x + 12 = 30 - 3 (2/7)x + 12 = 27 (2/7)x = 15 Multiply both sides by 7: 2x = 105 ‚áí x = 52.5

mcqs.question_en: If a/3 = b/2 then value of  is 2a+3b/3a-2b is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: a/3 = b/2 Cross-multiply: 2a = 3b ‚Üí a = (3b)/2 Now plug this value of a into the expression: (2a + 3b) / (3a - 2b) = [2(3b/2) + 3b] / [3(3b/2) - 2b] = (3b + 3b) / (9b/2 - 2b) = 6b / [(9b - 4b)/2] = 6b / (5b/2) = 6b √ó (2/5b) = 12/5

mcqs.question_en: If 2x + y = 5 then 4x + 2y is equal to ____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the value of 4x + 2y , we can multiply the given equation 2x + y = 5 by 2. Multiplying both sides by 2 gives : 4x + 2y = 2(5) 4x + 2y = 10 So, the correct answer is: 10

mcqs.question_en: If the average of five numbers is -10, and the sum of three of the numbers is 16, then what is the average of the other two numbers?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sum of the 5 number = -10 * 5 = -50 Sum of the 3 numbers = 16 Sum of other 2 numbers = -50 - 16 = -66 Average of the 2 numbers = -66/2 = -33 .

mcqs.question_en: The average age of 24 boys and a teacher is 15. When the teacher's age is excluded, the average decreases by 1. What is the age of the teacher?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total age of 24 boys and one teacher = 25 √ó 15 = 375 years Average age of 24 boys = 15 ‚àí 1 = 14 years Total age of 24 boys = 24 √ó 14 = 336 years Teacher's age = 375 ‚àí 336 = 39 years

mcqs.question_en: If a + b = 3(c + d), which of the following is the average (arithmetic mean) of a, b, c, and d?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation a + b = 3(c + d) We need to find the average of a, b, c, and d, which is: (a + b + c + d) / 4 Substitute a + b from the given equation: = [3(c + d) + c + d] / 4 = [4(c + d)] / 4 = c + d

mcqs.question_en: There are 40 animals in a zoo and per animal 20 packets of milk is required. One pack of milk contains 200 ml of milk, and milk costs 4.6 pesos per litre. If the employees of the zoo fulfil only 80% of the animal's intake of milk what will be the expenditure of the zoo?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: - 40 animals - Each animal needs 20 packets of milk - 1 packet = 200 ml - Milk cost = 4.6 pesos per litre - Only 80% of milk is provided Step 1: Total packets needed 40 animals √ó 20 packets = 800 packets Step 2: Total milk in ml 800 packets √ó 200 ml = 160,000 ml Step 3: Convert to litres 160,000 ml √∑ 1000 = 160 litres Step 4: Only 80% is provided 160 litres √ó 0.8 = 128 litres Step 5: Total cost 128 litres √ó 4.6 pesos = 588.8 pesos

mcqs.question_en: 158F convert into C?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To convert 158¬∞F to Celsius (¬∞C), use the formula: ¬∞C = (¬∞F ‚àí 32) √ó 5/9 ¬∞C = (158 ‚àí 32) √ó 5/9 = 126 √ó 5/9 = 630 / 9 = 70¬∞C

In January, 55 percent of a hospital's 300 patients were women. In February, 30 percent of its 440 patients were women. What was the percent change in the number of women patients from January to February?

mcqs.question_en: Suppose x = y - 2 = (y + 5) / 2. Then x equals?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation x = y - 2 = (y + 5) / 2 First, solve: y - 2 = (y + 5)/2 Multiply both sides by 2: 2y - 4 = y + 5 2y - y = 5 + 4 y = 9 Now, x = y - 2 = 9 - 2 = 7

mcqs.question_en: Social security law is an evolving law that tries as far as possible to reflect reality, to adjust to changes in and the needs of society.  12. Which of the following statements best summarizes the above?
options: Social security law gradually adapts itself to societal demands.
A good social security system ought to reflect every change in social values.
Changes in social conditions and needs imply the necessity for changes in social security legislation.
We need to study social needs.
mcqs.correct_answer: A good social security system ought to reflect every change in social values.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The statement is: "Social security law is an evolving law that tries as far as possible to reflect reality, to adjust to changes in and the needs of society." Key ideas: The law is evolving, not fixed. It adapts to social changes and needs. B) Social security law gradually adapts itself to societal demands. ‚Üí This matches perfectly: evolving + adjusting to needs.

mcqs.question_en: ANALYTICAL REASONING: A workshop that restores used pieces of furniture operates according to the following schedule:
options: Complete Question in the explanation portion
mcqs.correct_answer: Complete Question in the explanation portion
mcqs.explanation: Explanation ANALYTICAL REASONING Questions 1‚Äì4 A workshop that restores used pieces of furniture operates according to the following schedule: A piece of furniture is examined three calendar days after it is received in the workshop. (Thus, if it is received on the first day of the month, it is examined on the fourth.) On the next Monday following the examination, the piece of furniture is delivered to the restoration room. Restoration work may be finished one, two, or three calendar days after a piece of furniture is delivered to the restoration room. On the next Wednesday following the completion of the restoration work, a piece of furniture is varnished. Two calendar days later, the varnish is dry, and a piece of furniture may be shipped. All restored pieces of furniture are shipped at the close of business on the 15th or the 30th day of the month. This year, the first day of the month of January is a Friday. 1. If the workshop receives a steady supply of used pieces of furniture, on how many days during January will piece of furniture varnishing take place? A) Two B) Three C) Four D) Five E) Six Varnish only happens on Wednesdays. January Wednesdays = 6, 13, 20, 27 ‚Üí that‚Äôs 4. And because steady supply ensures that there‚Äôs always some piece ready, varnishing happens every Wednesday. * 2. If a used piece of furniture is received at the workshop on Tuesday, January 5th, its restoration work will be completed no later than: A) Monday the 11th B) Wednesday the 13th C) Thursday the 14th D) Friday the 15th E) Wednesday the 20th Receive = Jan 5 (Tue). Exam = Jan 8 (Fri). Next Monday = Jan 11 ‚Üí delivery. Restoration completes 1‚Äì3 days later ‚Üí at the latest = Jan 14 (Thu). * 3. To be certain that a restored piece of furniture will be shipped from the workshop on January 30th, what is the latest date by which it may be received at the workshop? A) Thursday the 14th B) Friday the 15th C) Saturday the 16th D) Monday the 18th E) Tuesday the 19th Work backwards: To be shipped Jan 30, varnish must be dry by Jan 30. Dry = varnish + 2 days. So latest varnish = Jan 28. But varnish must be a Wednesday, so the latest is Jan 27. For varnish on Jan 27, completion must be by Jan 26. Completion = delivery + ‚â§3 days ‚Üí latest delivery = Jan 23. But deliveries only occur Mondays ‚Üí must be Jan 18 (Monday). Delivery = next Monday after exam. For delivery Jan 18, exam must fall Jan 12‚Äì17. Exam = receive + 3. So receive must be no later than Jan 14 (exam on 17 ‚Üí delivery 18). *** 4. The longest delay in shipping a restored piece of furniture will involve a piece of furniture whose cover varnish dries on: A) January 1st B) January 8th C) January 15th D) January 22nd E) January 29th We want the case where varnish dries just after a shipping date, so the item must wait the longest before the next shipping date. If dry Jan 1 ‚Üí next ship Jan 15 ‚Üí 14-day wait. If dry Jan 8 ‚Üí next ship Jan 15 ‚Üí 7-day wait. If dry Jan 15 ‚Üí can ship immediately that same day ‚Üí 0-day wait. If dry Jan 22 ‚Üí next ship Jan 30 ‚Üí 8-day wait. If dry Jan 29 ‚Üí next ship Jan 30 ‚Üí 1-day wait. The longest wait = drying on Jan 1 ‚Üí wait until Jan 15 (14 days).

mcqs.question_en: Pointing to a women Raj says: She  is the grandfather of only son. Who is she?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The woman is Raj's mother The grandfather's only son is the woman's father. The woman's father's only son would be her brother or possibly herself if she is also the son in question, but the riddle states that the only son is also Raj's son in this riddle. The woman's father is the grandfather's only son. The woman's father's son is the woman's brother, and she is the sister of the woman.

mcqs.question_en: Marwa bought a book of Rs. 60 and a slate of Rs. 80. Find the percentage profit if she sold at Rs. 80.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Step 1: Total Cost Price (CP) CP = 60 + 80 = 140 Step 2: Selling Price (SP) SP = 80 Step 3: Profit or Loss text{Profit/Loss} = SP - CP = 80 - 140 = -60 Profit/Loss = SP ‚àí CP = 80 ‚àí 140 = ‚àí 60 This is a loss of Rs. 60 , not a profit. Step 4: Percentage Loss Loss¬†% = Loss/CP ‚Äã √ó 100 = 60 ‚Äã/140 √ó 100 Calculate: 60 ‚Äã/140 = 0.42857 0.42857 √ó 100 = 42.857% ‚âà 42.86%

mcqs.question_en: What is the slope of tangent at (2, 4) to the curve y = x¬≤?

mcqs.question_en: If, f has a relative maximum at x = c then?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation For a differentiable function f(x) , a relative maximum or minimum can only occur at a critical point . A critical point c is a value in the domain of the function where the first derivative (f'(c) is either zero or undefined . At a relative maximum , the slope of the tangent line to the graph of the function is zero, which is represented by the first derivative. This means that the function stops increasing and begins decreasing.

mcqs.question_en: The normal line to the circle x¬≤ + y¬≤ = 25 at (2, 3) is?

Given point: (2,3) The normal line at a point on the circle is the line passing through the center and the point. The slope of the line joining (0,0) and (2,3) is 3/2. The equation of the line passing through (0,0) and (2,3) can be found using point-slope form y = mx, where m is the slope. mcqs.question_en: A person travels from A to B at a speed of 40 kmph and returns by increasing his speed by 50%. What is his average speed for both the trips?

Formula for average speed when distance is the same but speeds differ: Average¬†speed = 2 √ó Speed 1 √ó Speed 2 Speed 1 + Speed 2 text{Average speed} = frac{2 times text{Speed}_1 times text{Speed}_2}{text{Speed}_1 + text{Speed}_2} ‚Äã ‚Äã Plug in values: = 2 √ó 40 √ó 60 40 + 60 = 4800 100 = 48 km/h = frac{2 times 40 times 60}{40 + 60} = frac{4800}{100} = 48 text{ km/h} = 2 √ó 40 √ó 60 ‚Äã 40 + 60 = 4800 /100 = 48 km/h

mcqs.question_en: Three unbiased coins are tossed, then the probability of getting two heads is?

Explanation The expression you provided is (A ‚à© B)^c . This is an application of De Morgan's Laws in set theory . De Morgan's Laws state : (A ‚à© B)^c = A^c U B^c (The complement of the intersection is the union of the complements). (A U B)^c = A^c ‚à© B^c (The complement of the union is the intersection of the complements). Therefore, the complement of the intersection of sets A and B is equal to the union of the complement of A and the complement of B .

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the number = x x/4 + 7 = 15 x/4 = 15 - 7 = 8 x = 8 √ó 4 = 32

mcqs.question_en: A book contains 40 pages, on each page, there are 20 lines and in each line there are 10 words. How many words does that book contain?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Words per line = 10 Lines per page = 20 ‚Üí¬†20 √ó 10 = 200 words per page Pages = 40 ‚Üí¬†200 √ó 40 = 8000 words in total

mcqs.question_en: If 15 boats row down a distance of 60 km in 5 hours. How many kilometers will be covered by 3 boats in one hour?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Distance covered = 60 km in 5 hours. So, speed =¬†60 √∑ 5 = 12 km/h . Number of boats does not affect distance or speed. So, in 1 hour, 3 boats (or any boats) will each cover 12 km .

mcqs.question_en: A's mother is aunt of my daughter. I have no brother. What is A to me?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If A‚Äôs mother is the aunt of my daughter, she must be a sibling of one of the parents (me or my spouse). Since I have no brother , the aunt is a sister ‚Äî her child (A) is my niece/nephew, so Nephew (male child) fits.

mcqs.question_en: In the morning, Saeeda read 100 pages at the rate of 60 pages per hour. In the evening, she read another 100 pages at the rate of 40 pages per hour. What was the average rate of reading for the day?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Morning reading time : Pages read = 100 pages Rate = 60 pages/hour Time taken = Pages / Rate = 100 / 60 = 5/3 hours Evening reading time: Pages read = 100 pages Rate = 40 pages/hour Time taken = Pages / Rate = 100 / 40 = 5/2 hours Total pages read : 100 pages (morning) + 100 pages (evening) = 200 pages Total time spent reading: 5/3 hours + 5/2 hours = 10/6 + 15/6 = 25/6 hours Average rate of reading: Average rate = Total pages / Total time Average rate = 200 pages / (25/6 hours) = 200 * (6/25) = (200/25) * 6 = 8 * 6 = 48 pages/hour

mcqs.question_en: If tomorrow (Monday) is first of the month, what will be the date two days after Sunday week?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Monday = 1 ‚Üí this week's Sunday = 7. ‚Äú Sunday week ‚Äù = the Sunday one week later = 14 . Two days after 14th is 16th .

mcqs.question_en: Which choice provides the answer in the following: 7 + 2 = 59, 5 + 3 = 28, 9 + 1 = 810, 2 + 1 = 13 then 5 + 4 = _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pattern for each equation is as follows: Subtract the second number from the first number. Add the first and second numbers. Combine the two results to form a new number. Let's apply this logic to the given examples: 7 + 2 = 59 7 - 2 = 5 7 + 2 = 9 Combined: 5 followed by 9, which is 59. 5 + 3 = 28 5 - 3 = 2 5 + 3 = 8 Combined: 2 followed by 8, which is 28. 9 + 1 = 810 9 - 1 = 8 9 + 1 = 10 Combined: 8 followed by 10, which is 810. 2 + 1 = 13 2 - 1 = 1 2 + 1 = 3 Combined: 1 followed by 3, which is 13. Solving for 5 + 4 Applying the same logic to 5 + 4: 5 - 4 = 1 5 + 4 = 9 Combined: 1 followed by 9, which is 19 .

mcqs.question_en: If A=1, H=8, then A+H-2 equal?

mcqs.question_en: 10% of 20% of 30% is equal to _____?

mcqs.question_en: Which of these is an odd number? 12, 24, 17 , 18

mcqs.question_en: If x¬≤ - x = 12 and y¬≤ - y = 12, then x - y = ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given: x¬≤ ‚àí x = 12 y¬≤ ‚àí y = 12 So both equations are equal: x¬≤ ‚àí x = y¬≤ ‚àí y ‚áí x¬≤ ‚àí x ‚àí y¬≤ + y = 0 ‚áí (x¬≤ ‚àí y¬≤) ‚àí (x ‚àí y) = 0 ‚áí (x ‚àí y)(x + y ‚àí 1) = 0 Now set each factor to zero: 1. x ‚àí y = 0 ‚Üí ‚áí x = y 2. x + y ‚àí 1 = 0 ‚Üí ‚áí x + y = 1 Now plug into original equation to find values: Try solving x¬≤ ‚àí x = 12 ‚áí x¬≤ ‚àí x ‚àí 12 = 0 ‚áí (x ‚àí 4)(x + 3) = 0 ‚áí x = 4 or x = -3 Case 1: x = 4 If x + y = 1 ‚áí y = -3 Then x ‚àí y = 4 ‚àí (‚àí3) = 7 Case 2: x = -3 If x + y = 1 ‚áí y = 4 Then x ‚àí y = -3 ‚àí 4 = ‚àí7 So possible values of x ‚àí y = 0 or ¬±7

mcqs.question_en: I went 15 km to the North, then turned West and covered 10 km. Then I turned South and covered 5 km, and then I turned East and covered 10 km. In which direction am I going and how far from starting point?

mcqs.question_en: A father tells his son, "I was of your present age when you were born." If the father is 36 years old now, how old was the boy 5 years ago?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let the son's present age = x Then father's age when son was born = x So current father's age = x + x = 2x Given father's age now = 36 ‚áí 2x = 36 ‚Üí x = 18 (son's current age) 5 years ago: 18 ‚Äì 5 = 13

mcqs.question_en: If Ali is 19th from both the front and the end in a row, how many persons are in the row?

mcqs.question_en: Amir is older than Nadeem by 4 years and Danish is younger than Saleem by 4 years, but Saleem's age is 1/4th of Amir's.   If Danish's age is 8 years, how many times is Nadeem in age to Saleem?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let Amir's age = A Then, Nadeem's age = A - 4 Saleem's age = (1/4) √ó A Danish is younger than Saleem by 4 years: ‚Üí Danish = Saleem - 4 ‚Üí 8 = (1/4)A - 4 ‚Üí (1/4)A = 12 ‚Üí A = 48 So: - Nadeem = A - 4 = 48 - 4 = 44 - Saleem = (1/4)A = 48 √ó (1/4) = 12 Now, how many times is Nadeem's age to Saleem's age? ‚Üí 44 √∑ 1 2 = 11/3

mcqs.question_en: Ayesha is 24 years old. She is twice as old as Benish. When she was as old as Benish, what is Benish's present age?

mcqs.question_en: Rahima is younger than Ahmed and Azmat is elder than Ahmed. Who is the eldest?

mcqs.question_en: A is father of C and D is son of B.E is brother of A. If C is sister of D, how is B related to E?

mcqs.question_en: A number exceeds another number by 5, the sum of the numbers is 19. Find the smaller number?

mcqs.question_en: Which one is different from other: painting, sketch, drawing, picture
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Painting, Sketch, Drawing ‚Üí All are forms of hand-made art. - Picture ‚Üí Typically refers to a photograph or image captured with a camera, not hand-drawn. So, "Picture" is different from the rest.

mcqs.question_en: Which is different?  A) ABC  B) FEG  C) LMN  D) XYZ
mcqs.explanation: Explanation All other options (A, C, D) contain letters in alphabetical order: - ABC ‚Üí A, B, C (in order) - LMN ‚Üí L, M, N (in order) - XYZ ‚Üí X, Y, Z (in order) But FEG is not in alphabetical order (E should come before F and G). Hence, FEG is different.

mcqs.question_en: If two pencils cost $1, how much will 5 pencils cost?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Cost of 2 pencils = $1, so the price of 1 pencil = $1 √∑ 2 = $0.50 . Cost of 5 pencils = 5 √ó $0.50 = $2.50 .

mcqs.question_en: What will be the next set of alphabets in the series? AZ, BY, CX, _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pattern appears to be: AZ (A=1, Z=26) BY (B=2, Y=25) CX (C=3, X=24) Following the pattern, the next set would be: D (4) and W (23) So, the next set of alphabets in the series would be DW .

mcqs.question_en: Aslam bought a bicycle for Rs. 10,000 and sold it for Rs. 11,000. What is his profit percentage?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Profit = Selling Price ‚àí Cost Price = 11,000 ‚àí 10,000 = 1,000 Profit % = (Profit / Cost Price) √ó 100 = (1,000 / 10,000) √ó 100 = 10%

mcqs.question_en: The evening is morning as dinner is to ____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The evening is morning as dinner is supper. Explanation: It is used to test our verbal ability in aptitude. Evening and morning are the opposite of each other. Similarly, dinner and supper is opposite each other. Supper is known as the remaining food from breakfast. Coffee and soup are not considered breakfast. Soup will be taken maximum in the evening or night and coffee will be taken in the early morning or evening time

mcqs.question_en: In the proportion a:b::c:d, the terma:d is called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In a proportion of the form a : b :: c : d, the terms a and d are called the extremes, while b and c are called the means. So, the ratio a : d (the first and the last terms) is called the Extreme Proportion.

mcqs.question_en: Rearrange the word AKLCIHA?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation City ‚Äî the letters rearrange to KALACHI , which is a village/town (city) in Kazakhstan (famous for reported "sleep" incidents).

mcqs.question_en: Rearrange the word DFFADLOI
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The rearranged word is Daffodil ‚Äî which is a flower .

mcqs.question_en: Pick the word from other ? Punjabi , English, Sindhi, Balochistan
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Odd one out: Balochistan Because Punjabi, English, and Sindhi are languages , But Balochistan is a place (province).

mcqs.question_en: What comes nest in the series? 8, 16, 24, 32
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The series increases by 8 each time: 8, 16 (+8), 24 (+8), 32 (+8), so next is 40

mcqs.question_en: Which does not belong with the others?Eagle, Crow, Hawk, Shark
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The animal that does not belong with the others is the shark because it is a fish, While the other three (eagle, crow, and hawk) are all birds of prey.

mcqs.question_en: If 1st January is Monday, what day is 31st January? Wednesday, Tuesday, Friday, Saturday
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 1st January = Monday January has 31 days ‚Üí 30 days after 1st Jan. 30 √∑ 7 = 4 weeks and 2 days remainder . So, 31st Jan will be 2 days ahead of Monday = Wednesday .

mcqs.question_en: Which one is least like the others?Football, volleyball, Hockey, Soccer
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Football, Volleyball, and Soccer are typically played with a ball. - Hockey is played with a puck (in ice hockey) or a small hard ball (in field hockey), but the gameplay and equipment differ significantly.

mcqs.question_en: Which word does not belong with the other? Sun, Star, Moon , Planet
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sun and Star are the same type (both stars). Planet and the Moon are different , but the Moon is a natural satellite, not a star or planet. So, Moon is the odd one out.

mcqs.question_en: Ali walk 10 meter to north,  turn right and walk 5 meter , turns right again and walk 10 meter. What is her from his starting.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Moves 10 m North (+10 N) - Moves 5 m East (+5 E) - Moves 10 m South (‚àí10 S) So, vertical moves cancel out (10 N ‚àí 10 S = 0), and only 5 m East remains. Net displacement = 5 m East

mcqs.question_en: Which one is not belong: Triangle, Rectangle, Square, Circle?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The shape that does not belong to the group is the Circle Because it is the only one that does not have s traight sides or angles, as it is a curved figure. Explanation: A triangle, rectangle, and square are all polygons, meaning they have straight sides and angles

mcqs.question_en: If log6 25 ‚àí 2 log6 5 + log6 a then the value of ‚Äòa‚Äô is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let's simplify the expression: log6 25 ‚àí 2 log6 5 + log6 a Since 25 = 5^2: log6 25 = log6 (5^2) = 2 log6 5 So, the expression becomes: 2 log6 5 - 2 log6 5 + log6 a = log6 a If this expression equals 0 (assuming that's the goal): log6 a = 0 This implies: a = 6^0 a = 1

mcqs.question_en: Find the missing number in the series: 2, 4, 3, 6, 4, __ ?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The given series is: 2, 4, 3, 6, 4, ? Let‚Äôs split the pattern into two alternating sequences: - 1st, 3rd, 5th terms: 2, 3, 4 ‚Üí increasing by 1 - 2nd, 4th, 6th terms: 4, 6, ? ‚Üí increasing by 2 So, the 6th term = 6 + 2 = 8

mcqs.question_en: Find the missing number in the series: 5, 7, 8, 10, 11, __, 13
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The given series is: 5, 7, 8, 10, 11, __, 13 Let‚Äôs look at the pattern: - 5 ‚Üí +2 ‚Üí 7 - 7 ‚Üí +1 ‚Üí 8 - 8 ‚Üí +2 ‚Üí 10 - 10 ‚Üí +1 ‚Üí 11 - 11 ‚Üí +2 ‚Üí 13 But 13 is at the end, so the missing number must be between 11 and 13. So we should insert +1 ‚Üí 12 before +1 to get 13. Correct answer: A) 12 Pattern: +2, +1, +2, +1, +2, +1..

mcqs.question_en: Ali is twice as old as his youngest brother. If the difference between their ages is 15 years. How old is his youngest brother?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Let brother‚Äôs age = x, so Ali‚Äôs age = 2x. 2x - x = 15 ‚Üí x = 15. Youngest brother is 15 years old.

mcqs.question_en: Shahid is older than Ahmed. Ahmed is older than Fatima. Fatima is older than Bilal. Who is the youngest among them?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shahid is older than Ahmed , so Shahid > Ahmed. Ahmed is older than Fatima , so Ahmed > Fatima. Fatima is older than Bilal , s o Fatima > Bilal.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Average speed = Total distance √∑ Total time = 150 km √∑ 3 hours = 50 km/h

mcqs.question_en: If yesterday was Friday then the day after tomorrow will be?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If yesterday was Friday, then today is Saturday. - Tomorrow ‚Üí Sunday - Day after tomorrow ‚Üí Monday

mcqs.question_en: What is the odd one out in 12, 20, 2, 5?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - 12 ‚Üí Even number - 20 ‚Üí Even number - 2 ‚Üí Even number - 5 ‚Üí Odd number Since 5 is the only odd number, while the rest are even, it does not follow the pattern.

mcqs.question_en: What comes next in the series: 63, 48, 35, 15, ___?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 63, 48, 35, 15, ? Now, find the differences between consecutive terms: - 63 ‚Üí 48¬† ‚Üí ‚àí15 - 48 ‚Üí 35¬† ‚Üí ‚àí13 - 35 ‚Üí 15¬† ‚Üí ‚àí20 Wait, something's off. Let's double-check with consistent logic. Try this: 63 - 15 = 48 48 - 13 = 35 35 - 20 = 15 Now we got: -15, -13, -20 ‚Üí Pattern doesn't seem linear. Try checking the alternating pattern: - 63 ‚Üí 48 (‚àí15) - 48 ‚Üí 35 (‚àí13) - 35 ‚Üí 15 (‚àí20) - 15 ‚Üí ? (maybe ‚àí13 again?) If the pattern alternates between ‚àí15, ‚àí13, ‚àí20, ‚àí13, then: 15 ‚àí 13 = 2

mcqs.question_en: Transpose of the product of matrices AB is equal to?
options: Transpose of A multiplied by Transpose of B
Transpose of B multiplied by Transpose of A
mcqs.correct_answer: Transpose of B multiplied by Transpose of A
mcqs.explanation: Explanation -¬†(AB)·µó = B·µó √ó A·µó - This is a standard matrix algebra rule Transpose reverses the order of multiplication Example: If A = 2√ó3 matrix, B = 3√ó2, then: (AB)·µó = B·µó √ó A·µó

mcqs.question_en: When Transpose of set B is equal to B, then it is called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A matrix B is symmetric if B·µó = B - This means the elements across the main diagonal are mirrored Example: Matrix B = [1 2] [2 3] Then B·µó = [1 2] [2 3] ‚áí Same as B ‚áí Symmetric

mcqs.question_en: If a value is added on both sides of the equation, it is called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Addition Property of Equality states: i f you add the same number to both sides of an equation, the equality remains unchanged. Absolute value refers to the distance of a number from zero on the number line, always positive.

mcqs.question_en: S = {1, 2, 3, 4} is a set of:
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Natural Numbers: These are the counting numbers starting from 1 (i.e., 1, 2, 3, 4, ...). The given set S = {1, 2, 3, 4} exactly fits this definition. - Whole Numbers: Whole numbers start from 0 (i.e., 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, ...). Since 0 is missing in the set, it's not a set of whole numbers. - Prime Numbers: Prime numbers are numbers greater than 1 that are only divisible by 1 and themselves. In this set: - 1 is not a prime number, - 4 is not a prime number (4 is divisible by 2). So it's not a set of primes. - Even Numbers: Even numbers are divisible by 2. In the set: Only 2 and 4 are even; 1 and 3 are odd. So it‚Äôs not a set of even numbers either.

mcqs.question_en: Matrices do not obey which of the following laws?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Matrices do not obey the Commutative Law of Multiplication; for matrices A and B, AB is generally not equal to BA, unlike with regular numbers. While both matrix addition and scalar multiplication of matrices follow commutative and associative laws, The commutative law does not hold for matrix multiplication.

mcqs.question_en: For anti clock-wise rotations directions of angular velocity is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Angular velocity is positive when the rotation is counter clockwise and negative when it is clockwise

mcqs.question_en: What is the cardinality of the set A = {1, 2, 3, 4}?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Cardinality refers to the number of elements in a set. Set A has 4 elements , so its cardinality is 4 .

mcqs.question_en: Power set of a nonempty set X is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The power set of a nonempty set X is the set of all subsets of X, including X itself and the empty set. It forms a topology on X.

mcqs.question_en: In matrices, which operation holds the commutative property?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The commutative property means A √ó B = B √ó A. - For matrices , Addition is commutative: A + B = B + A. - Multiplication of matrices is not generally commutative: A √ó B ‚â† B √ó A. - Subtraction is not commutative either: A - B ‚â† B - A.

mcqs.question_en: The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from a point 20m away from its base is 60 ‚àò . The height of the tower is-
mcqs.explanation: Explanation We can solve this problem using trigonometry. Let's denote: ‚Ñé h as the height of the tower, ùëë d as the horizontal distance from the point to the base of the tower, ùúÉ Œ∏ as the angle of elevation (which is 60 degrees in this case). In a right triangle formed by the tower, the horizontal distance, and the line of sight to the top of the tower, we have: tan ‚Å° ( ùúÉ ) = ‚Ñé ùëë tan ( Œ∏ ) = d h ‚Äã Given that ùúÉ = 6 0 ‚àò Œ∏ = 6 0 ‚àò and ùëë = 20 d = 20 meters, we can plug in these values and solve for ‚Ñé h : tan ‚Å° ( 6 0 ‚àò ) = ‚Ñé 20 tan ( 6 0 ‚àò ) = 20 h ‚Äã 3 = ‚Ñé 20 3 ‚Äã = 20 h ‚Äã ‚Ñé = 20 √ó 3 h = 20 √ó 3 ‚Äã ‚Ñé ‚âà 20 √ó 1.732 h ‚âà 20 √ó 1.732 ‚Ñé ‚âà 34.64 h ‚âà 34.64 So, the height of the tower is approximately 34.64 meters.

mcqs.question_en: The chord passing through the center of the circle is known as ____

mcqs.explanation: Explanation A chord is a line segment whose ends lie on the ends of a circle. When a chord passes through the center of the circle, it is called the diameter of the circle. ** ND17-1-2023

mcqs.question_en: If A is a matrix, then what is true about the transpose and complement of A?
options: The transpose of the complement of A is equal to -A.
The complement of the transpose of A is equal to A.
The complement of the transpose of A is equal to -A.
mcqs.correct_answer: The complement of the transpose of A is equal to A.
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The complement of a matrix typically means changing the signs of all its elements. The transpose involves swapping the rows and columns of the matrix. Thus, the transpose of the complement of a matrix A is equal to the negative of A, i.e., -A.

mcqs.question_en: If the sum of two angles is 180¬∞, they are called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Two angles are called supplementary when their measures add up to 180 degrees. Two angles are called complementary when their measures add up to 90 degrees.

mcqs.question_en: If the sum of two angles 90 then angles are called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Two angles are called complementary when their measures add up to 90 degrees. Two angles are called supplementary when their measures add up to 180 degrees.

mcqs.question_en: If a, b, c ‚àà R then _____?
options: a < b ‚üπ b + c < a + c
a < b ‚üπ a + c = b + c
a < b ‚üπ  a + c < b + c
mcqs.correct_answer: a < b ‚üπ  a + c < b + c
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If a, b, c ‚àà R (real numbers), then: a < b ‚üπ a + c < b + c This is a fundamental property of inequalities, which states that adding the same value to both sides of an inequality preserves the inequality .

mcqs.question_en: If a set contains only one element, then it is called:
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A set that has one and only one element is called a singleton set. The cardinal number of this set is 1

mcqs.question_en: 1 mega is equal to
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mega is a unit prefix in metric systems of units denoting a factor of one million (106 or 1000000). It has the unit symbol M. It was confirmed for use in the International System of Units (SI) in 1960. Mega comes from Ancient Greek.

mcqs.question_en: What is Odd man out in CAB, FDE, LIK, UTS
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In CAB , FDE , and LIK , the letters are in reverse alphabetical order : C ‚Üí B (backward) F ‚Üí E L ‚Üí K But in UTS : U ‚Üí T ‚Üí S (also in reverse order, but further down the alphabet and doesn't follow the same letter spacing pattern).

mcqs.question_en: Look at this series: 53, 53, 40, 40, 27, 27, ... What number should come next?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In this series, each number is repeated, then 13 is subtracted to arrive at the next number. Rule = (1st number) (1st number) (1st number - 13 = 2nd number) (2nd number repeat) (2nd - 13 = 3rd number) (3rd number repeat).... The series is 53, 53, 40, 40, 27, 27... (53),(53 - 13 = 40), (40), (40 - 13 = 27) (27), (27 - 13 = 14), (14)... So the answer is 14.

mcqs.question_en: Solve the following ? 1234 = 37 3456=?

mcqs.question_en: Complete the series: AZ, BY, CX, ______?

mcqs.question_en: If a man faces north, then turns left, and again turns left, what is his current direction?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If a man is facing north a nd turns left, he will be facing west. If he turns left again, he will then be facing south. Starts : Facing North. First turn left: From North, a left turn leads to West. Second turn left: From West, another left turn leads to the South.

mcqs.question_en: Choose the word which is different from the rest: Crocodile, Chicken, Snake, Swan
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Crocodile, snake, and swan can all live in or around water , but chicken is a land-dwelling bird. Also, chicken is a fully domestic animal , unlike the others which are wild .

mcqs.question_en: If radius of a circle bisects a chord, it will be ____ to the chord?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In a circle, if a radius (or line from the center) bisects a chord (divides it into two equal parts), It is perpendicular to that chord. This is a standard geometric property of circles.

mcqs.question_en: A series contains values 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4. Its standard deviation is?

mcqs.question_en: A series contains values 5, 9, 3, 1, 4, 6. Its median is?

mcqs.question_en: A relation in which the equality is true only for a number of unknowns is called an?

mcqs.question_en: If AB = BA then matrices are ______ communicative to each other.

mcqs.question_en: 72 is the sum of which consecutive even numbers?

mcqs.question_en: If a¬≤ + b¬≤ = 18 and a + b = 8, the value of ab is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Using the Given Equations Given: a^2 + b^2 = 18 and a + b = 8 Squaring the Second Equation (a + b)^2 = 8^2 a^2 + 2ab + b^2 = 64 Substituting a^2 + b^2 = 18 18 + 2ab = 64 Solving for ab 2ab = 64 - 18 2ab = 46 ab = 23

mcqs.question_en: If set A contains 2 elements and set B contains 3 elements, how many relations can be formed from A √ó B?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Calculating the Number of Relations Number of elements in A = 2 Number of elements in B = 3 Number of elements in A √ó B = 2 √ó 3 = 6 Calculating the Number of Relations Number of relations = 2^6 = 64

mcqs.question_en: If¬†A ‚à™ B= {a, c, e, i, m, n, o} and¬†A ‚à© B={e, i, o}. Then¬†AŒîB is _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Understanding the Symmetric Difference AŒîB = (A ‚à™ B) - (A ‚à© B) Given: A ‚à™ B = {a, c, e, i, m, n, o} and A ‚à© B = {e, i, o} Calculating the Symmetric Difference AŒîB = {a, c, e, i, m, n, o} - {e, i, o} = {a, c, m, n}

mcqs.question_en: If z = 3 + 4i, find the conjugate of z bar is ______?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Finding the Conjugate of z bar Given: z = 3 + 4i The conjugate of z, denoted as z bar, is 3 - 4i. The conjugate of z bar is 3 + 4i.

mcqs.question_en: ‚àö68 can be expressed in its simplest form as?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation ‚àö68 = ‚àö4√ó17 = 2‚àö17

mcqs.question_en: Which one of the following represents the commutative property?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Commutative property means the order doesn‚Äôt matter: ùê¥ ‚àó ùêµ = ùêµ ‚àó ùê¥ . Union ‚à™ is commutative, so ùê¥ ‚à™ ùêµ = ùêµ ‚à™ ùê¥.

mcqs.question_en: Range of cosec?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The cosecant function (cosec Œ∏ = 1/sin Œ∏) is undefined for sin Œ∏ = 0, And its values are always greater than or equal to 1 or less than or equal to -1. Hence, the range is y ‚â§ -1 or y ‚â• 1.

mcqs.question_en: If A or B is zero in the equation Ax¬≤ + By¬≤ + Gx + Fy + c = 0, then the conic is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If either A or B is zero in the conic equation Ax¬≤ + By¬≤ + Gx + Fy + c = 0, the conic represents a parabola.

mcqs.question_en: If A and B have the same signs in the equation Ax¬≤ + By¬≤ + Gx + Fy + c = 0, then the conic is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The general second-degree equation for conic sections is: Ax¬≤ + By¬≤ + Gx + Fy + c = 0 - If A and B have the same signs and are equal, the conic is a circle. - If A and B have the same signs but are not equal, the conic is an ellipse. - If A and B have opposite signs, the conic is a hyperbola. - If either A or B is zero, the conic is a parabola.

mcqs.question_en: If A is the proper set of B then A-B is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If A is a proper subset of B (meaning all elements of A are in B, but B has at least one element not in A), then A - B is the empty set (denoted as {} or ‚àÖ).

mcqs.question_en: For two non-empty sets A and B, B - A?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation B - A represents the set of elements that are in B but not in A. The correct notation is: {x | x ‚àà B and x ‚àâ A}

mcqs.question_en: If A is to the south B and C is to the east of B. In which direction is A with respect to C?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The correct relationships are: A is South of B C is East of B A is South-West of C

mcqs.question_en: If a>b, b>c, and d>a then?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Given the conditions: a>b b>c d>a We can draw the following relationships: From a>b and b>c, we know that a>c. From d>a, we know d>a and, since a>b and a>c, it follows that d>b and d>c. So, the only valid option is b

mcqs.question_en: If A={1,2,3,4,5} and B={1,2,5,9} than which is true?
